timeline.bodyText: Do we need to support Java 1.7? I think we currently support Java 1.8 and higher in KIE.
timeline.author: jiripetrlik
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,65 @@
+<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
+
+<project xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns="http://maven.apache.org/POM/4.0.0"
+         xsi:schemaLocation="http://maven.apache.org/POM/4.0.0 http://maven.apache.org/xsd/maven-4.0.0.xsd">
+  <modelVersion>4.0.0</modelVersion>
+
+  <parent>
+    <groupId>org.kie</groupId>
+    <artifactId>kie-pmml-models</artifactId>
+    <version>7.34.0-SNAPSHOT</version>
+  </parent>
+
+  <artifactId>kie-pmml-models-archetype</artifactId>
+  <packaging>jar</packaging>
+
+  <name>KIE :: PMML :: Models :: Archetype</name>
+  <description>Archetype for actual PMML model implementation</description>
+
+  <properties>
+    <project.build.sourceEncoding>UTF-8</project.build.sourceEncoding>
+    <maven.compiler.source>1.7</maven.compiler.source>

timeline.bodyText: This file is needed only for Drools-based implementation so it should be optional or we should have two different archetypes
timeline.author: danielezonca

timeline.bodyText: Is it needed that the new module will have kie-pmml-models as parent?
timeline.author: danielezonca

replies.bodyText:
@danielezonca
Yes. This archetype is meant to generate model-specific (sub)-module inside "models" module. Not sure to understand reason of your question.
replies.author: gitgabrio

replies.bodyText: The reason of the question is because I was considering this archetype to be used in general to create new implementation, inside this codebase or not
replies.author: danielezonca

replies.bodyText:
@danielezonca
Ok, understood. But I would prefer to not consider this option right now. It surely add some (slight) complications for a use case that maybe won't happen.
replies.author: gitgabrio

timeline.message: [DROOLS-5103] Movedo archetype to main PMML root. Automatic generation of archetypeId
[DROOLS-5103] Fixed as per PR suggestion. Add IT tests
